scenes.description: Memory of a party: the love interest looking her in the eyes and saying 'te ves hermosa' while someone applies a temporary tattoo.
Francisco once wondered if she was trans, transitioning 'in the other direction'; his girlfriend told him not to ask.
An ex says she always thought the narrator had 'fine features,' contradicting her earlier statement that her transness was 'obvious.'

events.description: The question that punctures avoidance: everyone knows about Molly's birthday and the exclusion.
The intentional exclusion from the birthday celebration becomes social knowledge.
Vix's question reveals the social exposure: the rejection has become public knowledge.
The birthday the narrator wasn't invited to, marking the rejection.

events.old: I Am Such A Shitty Excuse Of
events.new: A Shitty Excuse of a Person
events.description: Self-loathing spiral counting unreplied messages across multiple platforms.

events.old: S With Her Ex As A Man
events.description: Sex dream where she appears as a man produces disgust and shame—the unconscious betraying with unwanted identity.

events.old: T Do What Flore Did To Me
events.new: I Hope I Won't Do What Flore Did
events.description: Self-awareness about repeating the exact pattern done to her—planning a date with someone she's not attracted to.
Ritual of deleting contacts: Molly's number goes easily, but Flore's is harder to erase.

events.new: Consciously I Knew I Wasn't Going to See Her
events.description: Deliberate detour toward Little Italy where Flore lives, self-aware stalking behavior.
Catching glimpses in store windows, not recognizing her own reflection.
Unable to focus at the lab, depression pervading the day—a failure to function.
Less than a minute of public breakdown walking home from first therapy session.

events.old: My Name Will Be Recorded In The
events.description: Missing the 750words challenge exactly when feeling most like a failure.
Viewing Instagram story despite knowing her name will appear in viewers list—meta-awareness of obsessive surveillance.
Full hangover morning after drunk wandering: sickness, shame, four trips to the bathroom.
Correct gendering in elevator still catches her off-guard after five years of transition.

scenes.new: I'd Have Died With the Men
scenes.description: Watching the TV series alone, struck by dysphoric recognition: she would have died with 'the other men.'

events.old: If I Were In That World I
events.new: If I Were In That World I'd Have Died
events.description: Dysphoric ideation triggered by Y: The Last Man—imagining death with men despite being a trans woman.

scenes.description: Calli asks about impending doom. The answer comes clearly: bottle, drunk, cutting again. The scenario articulated to a professional.

events.description: Naming the self-harm risk aloud to therapist—the pull toward destruction articulated.
Phone checking loop, considering whether to attend, the familiar avoidance pattern.

events.old: 2 And A Half Hours Of My
events.new: Two and a Half Hours of Conference
events.description: The conference dismissal, feeling irrelevant in academic spaces.
The thinness photo, body inventory, the pattern of control through restriction.

events.old: I Feel Absolutely Nothing I Wasn
events.description: Emotional numbness, last sleeping pill, failed attempts at connection.

events.old: S Not Even A Slight Relief I
events.description: The empty notification, waiting for validation that never arrives.

events.old: S Busy This Weekend Ottawa Trip -
events.description: The disappointment of postponed plans, recognizing the third girl pattern.

events.old: S Wedding Surfaces On Instagram Roommate
events.description: Friend's wedding surfaces on Instagram—another event she wasn't invited to.

events.old: The Girl On The Phone Wasn
events.new: The Girl on the Phone Wasn't There
events.description: Therapy session revelation about misgendering, the period question memory surfaces.
Midnight work session, watching for WhatsApp status changes, medication questions surfacing.
The revelation about timing, Kate's pattern of silence becoming clear.

events.old: If She Were Interested She Didn
events.new: If She Were Interested She Didn't Show It
events.description: Analyzing the blonde's smiles, wondering which kind were hers.

events.old: S Conversation Messaging Alix While She
events.description: Karaoke flirtation, Kate's return, Saturday stillness with digital connections.

events.old: S Compassionate Response To The Narrator
events.description: Video call confession about Sonny's new person, receiving understanding.
Monica's diagnosis of the narrator's behavior: fuckboi pattern recognized.
Empty apartment, three messages sent, therapy eve planning, the longer history unfolding.
